title: Vintage Antique Collecting
description: From flea markets to estate sales, test your knowledge of the wonderful world of antique collecting!

questions.question: How old does an item generally need to be to be considered a true 'antique' by most definitions?

What popular weekend event, often held in fields and parking lots, was a treasure trove for antique collectors?
Which publication, with its distinctive yellow cover, was the go-to price guide for antique collectors?
What type of iridescent pressed glass, originally made as carnival prizes in the early 1900s, became highly collectible?
What term describes items that are old enough to be interesting but not yet 100 years old?
Which TV show, first airing in 1979 on PBS, featured experts appraising people's antiques and collectibles?
What white, opaque glassware, popular for collecting, was made by companies like Westmoreland and Fenton?
What antique stoneware containers, often decorated with cobalt blue designs, were used for preserving food?
What process of restoring antique furniture by removing old finish and applying new stain was a popular weekend project?
What type of sale, held when someone passes away or moves, often yielded the best finds for antique collectors?
